meanings.definition: The amount that can be held in one hand.
meanings.sent1: She picked up a handsful of colorful marbles.
meanings.sent2: He only needed a handsful of coins to pay for the candy.
meanings.sent3: The toddler tried to carry a handsful of toys, but they kept slipping out of his grasp.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a handsful of memories, each one precious and fragile.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully measured a handsful of spices to add to the stew.

meanings.sent1: There were only a handsful of people at the party.
meanings.sent2: She had a handsful of tasks to complete before the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: The cat caught a handsful of mice in the barn.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a handsful of worries, each one nagging at him.
meanings.sent5: The teacher gave the students a handsful of pencils to share for the test.
